subject: RE: [junit] Re: Problem in running Sample tests
msgSnippet: Pradeep, One potential problem I can see is that your JUnit 4 test classes should not extend TestCase. Cheers, Kent Beck Three Rivers Institute _____ From:
messageBody:
Pradeep,

One potential problem I can see is that your JUnit 4 test classes should not
extend TestCase.

Cheers,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute


_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
pradeep_3diitr
Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2006 10:35 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: Problem in running Sample tests



Hi, I am getting following Warning while running a parametrized
Junit test -

The source attachment does not contain the source for the file
TestSuite

Following is the progam -->

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.Collection;

import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;

import junit.framework.TestCase;

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)

public class FibbonacciTest extends TestCase {

@Parameters
public static Collection data()
{
return Arrays.asList(new Object[][]{{1,1},{2,1},
{3,2},{4,3},{5,5}});
}

private int _input;
private int _expected;

public FibbonacciTest(int input,int expected)
{
_input = input;
_expected = expected;
}

@Test public void test()
{
assertEquals
(_expected,Fibbonacci.nthFibbonacciElement(_input));
}


}
How can resolve this?

Regards,
Pradeep

--- In junit@yahoogroups. <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> com, Mark Salter
<marksalter@...> wrote:
>
> pradeep_3diitr wrote:
> > When I am trying to run Sample Test Cases (JUnit standard
package) I
> > get following error -
> >
> > D:\Pradeep\Downloads\JUnitDownloaded2\junit4.1>java
> > junit.samples.AllTests
> > Exception in thread "main"
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError:
> > junit/samples
> > /AllTests (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
> You are using a different version of java to the one used to
compile the
> classes you are attempting to run.
>
> This version of JUnit requires java 1.5.
>
> --
> Mark
>
